page.title: 08Employment
page.content: Although it is predominantly an agricultural area, the latest census indicated that only 14% of the working population in the Wellbank/Kellas area were employed in agriculture, 79% in other jobs, and 6% unemployed. This is indicative of a tendency throughout the area. Apart from agriculture, the main local employers are two Haulage Contractors, two Blacksmiths/Engineers, and one firm of Coachbuilders. However, the work forces employed by these firms are comparatively small (e.g., two of the firms employ 14 people), and many of the people work outside the immediate area,predominantly in Dundee. With the continuing mechanisation of farm work, there is little likelihood that this trend will be reversed.
